intro: Echioides arvensis, commonly known as the field eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Echioides arvensis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings. It has a taproot that can be harvested and used in traditional herbal medicine.
